title._content: [Ruins of the Pueblo San Juan, New Mexico] (LOC)

description._content: O'Sullivan, Timothy H.,, 1840-1882,, photographer. [Ruins of the Pueblo San Juan, New Mexico] [United States], 1874 October. 1 photographic print on stereo card : stereograph, albumen. Notes: Title devised by Library staff, based on title of stereograph showing the same area in this series. Hand-written note on back of item: "Indian ruins?" Part of series: U.S. War Dept., Corps of Engineers; Geographical Explorations and Surveys West of 100th Meridian, Expedition of 1874; Lieut. Geo. M. Wheeler, commanding. This site is known as Salmon Pueblo. See "Setting the Stage" in Chaco's Northern Prodigies: Salmon, Aztec, and the Ascendancy of the Middle San Juan Region after AD 1100 / edited by Paul F. Reed. Title from National Archives Records: San Juan ruins. Photo shows the shadow cast by the photographer's stereo camera and tripod. (Source: Framing the West) Published in: Framing the West: The Survey Photographs of Timothy H. O'Sullivan / Toby Jurovics, Carol M. Johnson, Glenn Willumson, and William F. Stapp. New Haven: Yale University Press, 2010, p. 39. Subjects: Shadows--New Mexico--1860-1870. Format: Expedition photographs--1860-1870. Stereographs--1870-1880. Albumen prints--1870-1880. Rights Info: No known restrictions on publication. Repository: Library of Congress, Prints and Photographs Division, Washington, D.C. 20540 USA Persistent URL: hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/stereo.1s00421 hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/stereo.2s00421 Call Number: LOT 3427-4, no. 51 [item]
